name: z3

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

description:
Z3 is a theorem prover from Microsoft Research. It is licensed under the
MIT license.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gmp
dependencies.description:
GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on
signed integers, rational numbers, and floating-point numbers.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: llvm-doe
dependent_to.description:
This package provides a collection of the experimental LLVM projects
done by the US DOE research and development teams.

dependent_to.name: llvm
dependent_to.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.

dependent_to.name: composable-kernel
dependent_to.description:
Composable Kernel: Performance Portable Programming Model for Machine
Learning Tensor Operators.

dependent_to.name: impalajit
dependent_to.description:
A lightweight JIT compiler for flexible data access in simulation
applications. impalajit@llvm is enhanced with LLVM JIT. This means that
impalajit@llvm is supposed to work on any architecture supported by
llvm, contrary to the impalajit@main package which is restricted to x86
architectures.This comes at the price of extra dependencies. Impala acts
as a backend for `easi` project.

dependent_to.name: comgr
dependent_to.description:
This provides various Lightning Compiler related services. It currently
contains one library, the Code Object Manager (Comgr)

dependent_to.name: mlirmiopen
dependent_to.description: Multi-Level Intermediate Representation for rocm miopen project.

dependent_to.name: rocmlir
dependent_to.description:
This is the repository for a MLIR-based convolution and GEMM kernel
generator targetting AMD hardware. This generator is mainly used from
MIOpen and MIGraphX, but it can be used on a standalone basis.

dependent_to.name: rose
dependent_to.description:
A compiler infrastructure to build source-to-source program
transformation and analysis tools. (Developed at Lawrence Livermore
National Lab)

dependent_to.name: llvm-amdgpu
dependent_to.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.
